channel.title: Seriously Wtf / Spyware
channel.description:
This is the second time this has happened..
I was just browsing through some films, when avast pops up "Warning - Virus has been detected." I just moved the first one to vault, but then after a minuet or so about 5 pop up and then my desktop changes to "WARNING YOU HAVE SPYWARE". I ran "Exterminate It!" (Spyware Removal" which found 10 threats, 8 trojans, 2 hijackers. I restarted comp after they had been deleted, and i just got blue screen, no explorer, no desktop. I could still open stuff using task manager though.
I looked through my processes and i have an explorer.exe, but i think it is malicious, plus, i have 8 svchost.exe and i'm not sure if any of them are malicious though, i have never counted how many there were before.
The spyware isn't there anymore, no explorer or desktop, help ?

item.title: Seriously Wtf / Spyware
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:4, topic:230045”]By the way, for your convenience since you are running programs from the taskmanager, system restore can be found at:

C:\WINDOWS\system32\restore\rstrui.exe[/quote]
Or you could just start up into safe mode and log in as admin and click system restore.

Read full topic

item.title: Seriously Wtf / Spyware
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Common trojan horse. Remove THAT first, and all other crap won’t be installed on your computer without your knowledge. Seems to me like the Antivirus XP 2008 garbage (it goes by different names) as its happened to me before for no apparent reason.

Your solutions are:

  1. Perform a system restore to the latest safe check-point
  2. Identify the trojan and perform the neccessary tasks to remove the trojan (use Google and search for common symptoms of the trojan)
  3. Download an antivirus scanner and run a full system scan, remove all garbage
  4. Run a system scan at pcpitstop.com (or .net I forgot its been a while)

The aftermath:

  1. Get a firewall
  2. Periodic full system scans
  3. Stop the porn
  4. Think twice about what you’re doing on the 'net

Read full topic
